resources.string: Pune - A Confluence Of East and West

Pune is the second largest city in the Indian state of Maharashtra after Mumbai and the seventh most populous city in the country. 
 Pune is the administrative headquarters of Pune district and was once the centre of power of the Maratha Empire established by Shivaji Maharaj. 
 Cultural capital of Maharashtra, Pune is known as "Oxford of the East" due to several well-known educational institutions in the city. 
The city has emerged as a major educational hub in recent decades, with nearly half of the total international students in the country studying in Pune. 
The city is known for its manufacturing and automobile industries, as well as for research institutes of information technology (IT), education, management and training, which attracts students, and professionals from India, South East Asia, the Middle East and Africa, student-exchange programs with colleges in Europe. 
Pune is one of the fastest growing cities in the Asia-Pacific region. The ‘Mercer 2017 Quality of Living Rankings’ evaluated living conditions in more than 440 cities around the world and ranked Pune at 145, second in India after Hyderabad at 144. The same source highlights 
Pune among evolving business centres and nine emerging cities around the world with the citation "Hosts IT and automotive companies".
Landmarks
Adlabs Imagica
Dattwadi, Shobhapur, Kasba Peth, Pune, Maharashtra 411011.
Famous for amusement park, taking pictures with the cartoon characters on the grounds, enjoying performances by magicians, stilt walkers, jugglers and clowns.
Pataleshwar Caves
Jangali Maharaj Road, Revenue Colony, Shivajinagar, Pune 411005.
Rock cut cave temple dedicated to god Shiva that dates back to the 8th century is rectangular with a pillared porch famous for its umbrella shaped canopy held by massive square pillars.
Dagdusheth Ganesh Temple
Ganpati Bhavan, Budhvar Peth, Shivaji Road, Pune 411002.
Built in 1893, the beautiful temple has Jay and Vijay, the two sentinels made of marble and a 7.5 feet high Ganesh idol that attracts people coming to celebrate Ganesh festival.
Khadakwasla Dam
Near Khadakwasla Village, off Sinhagad Road, Pune 411024.
The dam is 1.6 km long and possesses 11 radial sluice gates and six irrigation outlets flowing into two canals. Famous for natural serenity, favourite tourist spot, cycling.
National Defence Academy (NDA - Pune)
NDA Alumni Association, National Defence Academy, Pune 411023.
First tri service academy in the world. Since its establishment, the cadets from the academy have fought in major conflicts in which the Indian Armed Forces has been called to action.
Places To Eat
Vaishali
1218/1, Fergusson College Road, Deccan Gymkhana, Pune 411004.
Famous for it\'s authentic South Indian dishes. Always crowded. The Mysore masala cheese dosa, ghee masala dosa, cutlets, s.p.d.p and filter coffee is specially famous.
Bedekar Misal
418 Munjabacha Bol, Narayan Peth, Pune 411030.
Grassroots Indian dining with self-service and open kitchen. Speciality: Misal served with bread. Also available: Batata Wada, Bhaji, Chirote, Kharvas, Shendana-Gulkhand Ladoo.
The Place - Sizzlers
119, National Highway 9, Camp, Pune 411001.
Oldest sizzler place in Pune. Quantity, rates are reasonable. Staff is friendly and service speed is good. Famous specially for the Chicken Peri Peri Shashlik sizzler.
Nisarga - Fish Paradise
6/1, Nalstop, Karve Road, Erandwane, Pune 411004.
Famous for seafood. Has indoor and outdoor seating area. Prawn biryani, fish fry, crab and lobster dishes are specially famous. Ambience is good. Very prompt service.
Le Plasir
Rajkamal Survey No. 759/125, Prabhat Road, Pune 411004.
Chic monochrome interior European bistro, famous for Espresso Panna Cotta, Macarons, Ham and Mushroom Mix leaf Salad and The Meat Loader Muffin to name a few.
Tech Parks
Magarpatta City TechPark
Magarpatta City, Hadapsar, Pune, Maharashtra.
Magarpatta city is the one of three largest IT parks in Pune. In Magarpatta city, the major IT companies present are Sybase, Accenture, Amdocs , TCS, Red Hat, IGATE and many more.
Hinjewadi IT Hub and TechPark
Hinjewadi Tech Park and Hub, Hinjawadi, Pune, Maharashtra.
Mainly known for the Rajiv Gandhi Infotech Park, the 2800-acre IT park houses companies like TCS, Wipro, KPIT, Tech Mahindra, Cap Gemini, Persistent.
Tech Park One - Yerawada
Vatika Business Centre Level-5, Yerwada, Pune 411006.
Tech Park One Pune is an executive business centre office space, meeting rooms and HD conferencing rooms in Pune. It provides Serviced Offices and Meeting Rooms.
Eon IT Park
Nagar Road, Kharadi, Pune, Maharashtra 411014.
Bluecode, Allscripts, Eaton Technologies, EpiComm, Affinity Express and Eclipsys are some of the well=know companies in Eon tech park.
Nanospace IT Park
Nano Space IT Park, Baner - Pashan Link Rd, Baner, Pune 411045.
Xoriant Solutions, Veritas Technologies, Bitwise Solutions, Enzigma Software, Harbinger Group, SphereGen Software are some of the well-known companies in the tech park.
Forts
Shaniwar Wada
Shaniwar Peth, Pune, Maharashtra 411030.
Built in 1732, seven-storied capital building of the Peshwas of the Maratha Empire until 1818. The perimeter wall has five gateways and nine bastion towers, a garden complex.
Fort Torna
Rajgad - Torna Trek Path, Charhat Wadi, Pune 412212.
Torna Fort, was the first fort captured by Shivaji Maharaja in 1643, at the age of 16, forming the nucleus of the Maratha empire. It is the highest fort in Pune at 1,403 m.
Fort Sinhagad
Sinhagad Ghat Road, Dist Pune, Thoptewadi, Maharashtra 411025.
Strategically built 2000 years ago providing natural protection due to its very steep slopes, bastions constructed only at key places, Sinhagad is pivotal to Maratha history.
Fort Shivneri
Imam Raza Nagar, Junnar, Pune, Maharashtra 410502.
Shivneri Fort is a 17th-century military fortification which is the birthplace of Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj, the founder of Maratha Empire.
Fort Visapur
Visapur Fort, Malavli, Pune, Maharashtra 410406.
Built during 1713-1720 CE by Balaji Vishwanath, the first Peshwa of Maratha Empire. Within the fort are caves, decorated arch, two massive bastions flanking central gate.
Famous Gardens
Bund Garden
Bund Garden, Sangamvadi, Pune, Maharashtra.
Offering something for everyone, Bund Garden is a favorite haunt for those looking for a quiet, scenic place close to Mother Nature that helps one relax and rejuvenate.
Peshwe Park
9, Sane Guruji Rd, Saras Baug, Pune 411030.
Peshwe Park has a solar pavilion, battery operated Phulrani train, children\'s playground, 50 adventure sports like wall climbing, grappling, high altitude cycling.
Empress Garden
Empress Graden, Kavade Mala, Ghorpadi, Pune 411001.
Empress Garden (since 1880) is home to many rare species of trees and flowers. The well landscaped garden consists of lush green lawns, play area, snack shack.
Pu. La. Deshpande Garden
Pune-Okayama Friendship Garden, Sinhagad Road, Pune 411030.
Pu La Deshpande Garden or Pune-Okayama Friendship Garden, is inspired by 300 year old Okayama Korakuen Garden. The garden boasts of lush green lawns and streams with fish.
Sambhaji Park
Sambhaji Park, Sambhaji Bridge, Pune, Maharashtra.
Sambhaji garden has jogging track for morning walkers, a huge fish aquarium, a mini fort specially made for kids and a big fountain to attract loads of people.
